title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Pencils of Promise
Interview Descriptions: Cover letter and resume, phone screen, assignment, panel interview, then final interview. I enjoyed the interviews and the assignment was a little long but straightforward​. I decline the offer but it's​ a great company doing amazing work.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pencils of Promise
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was average. I applied online and received an email to set up an interview with the hiring manager. The interview itself was not difficult. The hiring manager made me feel comfortable
Interview Questions: Asked me about my background/previous internships

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Pencils of Promise in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I filled out an online application and attached my resume and cover letter. I received an email inviting me to a phone interview. The interview was short - maybe 10 to 15 minutes long.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pencils of Promise (New York, NY) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and they emailed me shortly after. The interview was set for the following day. After that, they disappeared for two months (even though they said to contact me within a week with the final result), then I received a general rejection letter. So unprofessional!
Interview Questions: What is your biggest strength? Was is your biggest weakness? Why should we choose you and not other candidates?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Pencils of Promise (New York, NY) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied and then received an email to set up a phone interview. After the phone interview, I had a second in-person interview. A few days later I received an offer via email.
Interview Questions: Q: Where do you see yourself career-wise in five years, and how does this internship help you get there?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pencils of Promise
Interview Descriptions: 15 minute phone interview that covered the basics. After applying online, i was contacted via email concerning a phone interview, which was set for the following day. the phone interview was shorter than anticipated, but i think its simply because they know what theyre looking for.
